Detailed Description

Common functions for the AndroidTodo synchronization server.

Author:
Tobias Heer <heer@cs.rwth-aachen.de>

Tadeus Prastowo <eus@member.fsf.org>

Define Documentation

#define COMBINE_SEC_USEC ( sec,
usec   )     ((sec * 1000000ULL) + usec)

Form a time in microsecond given the second and the microsecond parts.

#define SC_DEFAULT_PORT   50001

Default port number.

#define SC_PACKET_TIMEO   2

Timeout in seconds.

#define SEC_PART ( t   )     (t / 1000000)

Extract the second component of a time in microsecond.

#define USEC_PART ( t   )     (t % 1000000)

Extract the microsecond component of a time in microsecond.

Typedef Documentation

typedef scream_packet_general scream_packet_client_server_ack

Prevent the client to resend its sync data by acknowledging the received data. The value of scream_packet_client_server_ack::type must be scream_packet_type::SC_PACKET_CLIENT_SERVER_ACK.

typedef scream_packet_general scream_packet_client_server_resp

Start client-to-server synchronization response packet. The value of scream_packet_client_server_resp::type must be scream_packet_type::SC_PACKET_CLIENT_SERVER_RESP.

typedef scream_packet_general scream_packet_register_ack

A register acknowledgement packet. The value of scream_packet_register_ack::type must be scream_packet_type::SC_PACKET_REGISTER_ACK.

typedef scream_packet_general scream_packet_reset

A reset packet. The value of scream_packet_reset::type must be scream_packet_type::SC_PACKET_RESET.

typedef scream_packet_general scream_packet_reset_ack

A reset acknowledgement packet. The value of scream_packet_reset_ack::type must be scream_packet_type::SC_PACKET_RESET_ACK.

typedef scream_packet_general scream_packet_server_client_resp_ack

Start server-to-client synchronization packet. The value of scream_packet_server_client_resp_ack::type must be scream_packet_type::SC_PACKET_SERVER_CLIENT_RESP_ACK.

typedef scream_packet_general scream_packet_server_client_sync

A server-to-client synchronization request packet. The value of scream_packet_server_client_sync::type must be scream_packet_type::SC_PACKET_SERVER_CLIENT_SYNC.

Enumeration Type Documentation

enum bool

Define boolean data type for C.

Enumerator:
FALSE  False.
TRUE  True.

enum chunk_type

AndroidTodo chunk types.

Enumerator:
CHUNK_UNKNOWN  Chunk number 0 is reserved. Do not use.
CHUNK_NEW_TODO  A new todo item to be stored.
CHUNK_UPDATE_TODO  An update for a todo item.
CHUNK_DELETE_TODO  Delete a todo item.
CHUNK_TODO  A todo item as stored in the sync server.
CHUNK_TODO_ID  The ID of a todo.
CHUNK_TODO_TITLE  The title of a todo.
CHUNK_TODO_DEADLINE  The deadline of a todo.
CHUNK_TODO_PRIORITY  The priority of a todo.
CHUNK_TODO_STATUS  The status of a todo.
CHUNK_TODO_DESCRIPTION  The description of a todo.
CHUNK_TODO_REVISION  The revision of a todo.
CHUNK_MAX  Maximum chunk type number.

enum err_code

Error code.

Enumerator:
SC_ERR_SUCCESS  It worked!
SC_ERR_NOMEM  Not enough memory.
SC_ERR_SEND  Send failed.
SC_ERR_SOCK  Socket error.
SC_ERR_INPUT  Wrong user input.
SC_ERR_PACKET  Malformed packet (too small or wrong format).
SC_ERR_STATE  State error. Unexpected input.
SC_ERR_DB_FULL  Maximum number of clients reached.
SC_ERR_COMM  Communication error. Host does not respond.
SC_ERR_RECV  Receive failed.
SC_ERR_SOCKOPT  Setting socket option failed.
SC_ERR_WRONGSENDER  Packet received from an unexpected host.
SC_ERR_LOCK  Screamer cannot lock the main channel.
SC_ERR_UNLOCK  Screamer cannot unlock the main channel.
SC_ERR_SIGNAL  Manager cannot signal the screamer.
SC_ERR_NAME  Socket has a problematic name.
SC_ERR_DB  DB error.

enum scream_packet_type

AndroidTodo packet/message types. WARNING: This must be kept in sync with AndroidTodo's TodoSyncCommunication class.

Enumerator:
SC_PACKET_UNKNOWN  Packet number 0 is reserved. Do not use.
SC_PACKET_REGISTER  Register packet.
SC_PACKET_REGISTER_ACK  Register acknowledgement packet.
SC_PACKET_SERVER_CLIENT_SYNC  Server-to-client synchronization request.
SC_PACKET_SERVER_CLIENT_RESP  Server-to-client synchronization response.
SC_PACKET_SERVER_CLIENT_RESP_ACK  Start server-to-client synchronization.
SC_PACKET_CLIENT_SERVER_SYNC  Client-to-server synchronization request.
SC_PACKET_CLIENT_SERVER_RESP  Start client-to-server synchronization.
SC_PACKET_CLIENT_SERVER_ACK  Client-to-server synchronization completes.
SC_PACKET_RESET  Reset packet.
SC_PACKET_RESET_ACK  Result acknowledgement packet.
SC_PACKET_SERVER_CLIENT_DATA  Todo items from server.
SC_PACKET_CLIENT_SERVER_DATA  Todo items from client.
SC_PACKET_MAX  Maximum packet type number.

long eus_strtol ( const char *  str,
int *  has_error,
const char *  what_is_str 
)

Convert a string into an integer of type long.

Parameters:
[in] str the string to be converted.
[out] has_error is set to zero if there is no conversion failure, to one if there is a failure.
[in] what_is_str the context to be printed in the error message.
Returns:
The integer represented by the string.

unsigned long long get_last_packet_ts ( int  sockfd  ) 

Return the timestamp in microsecond of the last received packet. The timestamp is measured since Unix epoch.

Parameters:
[in] sockfd the socket that has the last-received packet.
Returns:
The timestamp in microsecond, or zero if there is an error.

const char* get_scream_type_name ( scream_packet_type  type  ) 

Convert a type to a printable string.

Parameters:
[in] type the packet type to be converted.
See also:
scream_packet_type
Returns:
The string representing the given type.

bool is_sane ( const void *  buffer,
size_t  len,
size_t  expected_len 
)

Check if a piece of memory is a sane packet.

Parameters:
[in] buffer piece of memory to be checked.
[in] len length of the buffer.
[in] expected_len the expected length of the buffer.
Returns:
bool::TRUE if the packet has a recognized type and of size expected_len, bool::FALSE otherwise.

void remove_packet ( int  sock  ) 

Remove a UDP packet in the front of the buffer of sock.

Parameters:
[in] sock the socket whose first UDP datagram in its buffer will be removed.

err_code set_timeout ( int  socket,
const struct timeval *  timeout 
)

Set a receiving timeout on a socket.

Parameters:
[in] socket the socket whose receiving timeout is to be set.
[in] timeout the timeout for receiving a packet from the socket.
Returns:
An error code.

void sqlite3_clean_free ( void *  ptr_addr  ) 

Frees a pointer that is produced by either sqlite3_malloc() or sqlite3_realloc() and NULLified the pointer so that it is safe for reuse.

Parameters:
[in] ptr_addr the address of the pointer to be freed

void sqlite3_perror ( sqlite3 *  db,
const char *  message 
)

Produces a nice error message identical to perror().

Parameters:
[in] db the database whose latest error is to be produced.
[in] message the message to be printed before the error message.

err_code unset_timeout ( int  socket  )

Parameters:
[in] socket the socket whose receiving timeout is to be unset.
